task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 184°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building’s height accurately I need to see its roofline/top edge, so I should tilt the view upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now facing north instead of the required south-facing building, so I should rotate back to 180° to see the target building and its top.
To estimate height I need the roofline in view, so I should tilt upward while keeping the building centered to gauge its full vertical extent.
The camera has flipped back to facing north again, so I need to rotate to 180° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the building’s top.
I should stop rotating and instead give a height estimate based on a typical 3–4 story institutional building scale (≈3.5–4 m per story) visible ahead, suggesting around 4 stories plus roof.
